study.title: VX-950-TiDP24-C124: A Phase I Trial to Investigate the Potential Pharmacokinetic Interactions Between Telaprevir and Darunavir/Ritonavir and Between Telaprevir and Fosamprenavir/Ritonavir at Steady-state.

outcome_measures.outcome_measure: Effect of steady-state DRV/rtv 600/100 mg b.i.d. and steady-state of fAPV/rtv 700/100 mg on the steady-state PK of telaprevir 750 mg q8h and 1125 mg q12h and vice versa. Steady-state PK on telaprevir 750 mg q8h and 1125 mg q12h alone.
The secondary objective is to determine the short-term safety and tolerability of coadministration of telaprevir and DRV/rtv, and telaprevir and fAPV/rtv.

study.title: VX-950-TiDP24-C132: A Study to Investigate the Effect of Renal Impairment on the Pharmacokinetics of Telaprevir.

outcome_measures.outcome_measure: The primary objective of this study is to investigate the effect of severe renal impairment on the single-dose pharmacokinetics of total telaprevir. Total telaprevir is the sum of telaprevir bound to plasma proteins and unbound (free) telaprevir.
The effect of severe renal impairment on total and unbound plasma concentrations of the sum of TVR and VRT-127394 will be investigated.
Safety and tolerability of a single dose of telaprevir will be determined.

study.title: VX-950-TiDP24-C136 - A Trial to Evaluate the Effect of Telaprevir (TVR) on the Results of Electrocardiograms (Electric Recording of the Heart) in Healthy Volunteers

outcome_measures.outcome_measure: The primary objective is to evaluate the effect of administration of TVR 750 mg every 8 hours and 1875 mg every 8 hours, both at steady-state, versus placebo on the QT and QTc interval (heart activity) in healthy volunteers.
Trial sensitivity will be evaluated (i.e., the effect of a positive control, a single 400 mg dose of moxifloxacin, on the QT/QTc interval).
The effect of 2 different regimens of TVR on non-QT interval electrocardiogram (ECG) parameters (RR interval, HR, PR interval, and QRS interval) will be evaluated.
The pharmacokinetics of 2 dose regimens of TVR, 750 mg every 8 hours and 1875 mg every 8 hours, at steady-state will be evaluated.
The concentration-effect relationship for QT/QTc for TVR will be explored.
The short-term safety and tolerability of 2 dose regimens of TVR, 750 mg and 1875 mg every 8 hours will be evaluated.

study.title: An Open-Label Study of the Effect of Telaprevir in Combination With Peginterferon Alfa-2b and Ribavirin in Pediatric Subjects Infected With Hepatitis C Virus

Part B: Number of incidence for Flu-like symptoms (as defined by pyrexia or chills or pain)
Part B: Number of incidence for Musculoskeletal symptoms (as defined by arthralgia or myalgia or back pain)

study.title: An Observational Study of Dual and Triple Therapies Based on Pegasys (Peginterferon Alfa-2a) in Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C

outcome_measures.outcome_measure: Sustained Virological Response (SVR)-24 rate: Percentage of patients with HCV RNA <50 IU/mL at 24 weeks post completion of treatment
Dual versus triple Pegasys-based therapy: SVR-24 rates
Correlation between SVR-24 and clinical/demographic baseline values
Predictive value of on-treatment factors (RVR, eRVR, EVR, EOT) on virological response (HCV-RNA <50 IU/mL): Percentage of patients with rapid/rapid extended/early/end of treatment response
Treatment duration
Dose reductions/treatment discontinuations
Correlation between dose reductions/treatment interruptions and sustained virological response (SVR)
Safety: Incidence of adverse events (dual versus triple therapy)
Rate of treatment-induced anemia (dual versus triple therapy)
Treatment regimens for HCV treatment induced anemia in routine clinical practice
Rate of virological relapse

study.title: Study to Determine the Safety and Effectiveness of Antiviral Combination Therapy to Treat Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) in Patients Who Have Previously Not Received the Standard of Care

outcome_measures.outcome_measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response at Post Treatment Week 12 (SVR12)
Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response at Post Treatment Week 24 (SVR24)
Percentage of Participants With Viral Breakthrough During the Treatment Period
Percentage of Participants Who Experienced Viral Relapse During Follow-up Period
Change From Baseline in log10 Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) RNA at Follow-up Week 24
Number of Participants Who Died and With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) and Grade 3-4 Adverse Events (AEs), During the Treatment Period Prior to Addition of Rescue Therapy
Number of Participants Who Died and With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Grade 3-4 Adverse Events (AEs), and Grade 3-4 Abnormalities on Laboratory Test Results During Follow-up Period

study.title: An Observational Study of Peginterferon (e.g. Pegasys)-Based Direct Acting Antiviral Triple Therapy in Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C Genotype 1

outcome_measures.outcome_measure: Safety: Time to premature treatment discontinuation due to any reason
Efficacy: Sustained virological response rate, defined as percentage of patients with undetectable HCV RNA (HCV RNA </= 50 IU/mL) at 24 weeks post-completion of treatment
Occurrence of premature discontinuation of treatment according to reasons (VR/resistance development/AE/compliance)
Association between degree of dose reductions/treatment interruptions and sustained virological response
Occurrence of virological rebound
Virological response/virological rebound in correlation with hepatitis C virus genotype
Virological response in relation to treatment duration after becoming HCV RNA undetectable
Safety: Incidence of adverse events
Work Productivity and Activity Impairment Questionnaire: General Health (WPAI:GH)
Virological response in correlation with baseline clinical/demographic patient characteristics
Virological response in correlation with treatment (regimen/dosage/compliance/co-medication)
Treatment duration according to treatment regimens
Percentage of patients treated according to US labeling

Log change in HCV response

Liver disease progression
